description: From Latin folium (“leaf”). Doublet of foil and folio, distantly also with phyllo and phyllon.

nouns.description: folium (countable and uncountable, plural foliums or folia)

entries.meaning: A leaf, especially a thin leaf or plate.
(geometry) A curve of the third order, consisting of two infinite branches having a common asymptote. The curve has a double point, and a leaf-shaped loop.
